posts.post_content:
Currently creating a hexproof equip deck featuring this guy  
  
T1: [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves)  
T2: [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod)  
T3: [Sacred Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Wolf)  
T4: Sac the Wolf, put Thrun into play  
T5: [Angelic Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Destiny) to create Thrun, the last Troll Angel (and likely the first)

posts.post_content: I feel like they are really trying to encourage green shenanigans in the current meta. This guy, [Ezuri's Brigade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ezuri's Brigade), [Green Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Green Sun's Zenith), [Ezuri, Renegade Leader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ezuri, Renegade Leader), [Elvish Archdruid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Archdruid), [Copperhorn Scout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Copperhorn Scout) is even pretty absurd. All have crazy abilities, and are really attractively costed, and thats not even diving into the crazyness of New Phyrexia. I hope to see more once Jace & Pigeon go away.
posts.html:

Posted By: marwinshieldscale (6/21/2011 10:19:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ah Thrun, the card that every color hates. ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) can't cancel it, bounce it, or control it, ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) can't bolt it, at best it's a life engine for ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) with lifelink cards, ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) can't arrest or tap them, and all ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) can hope for is to trample over him or play the same card. Ironic that the color of the deck that plays him is the most common method to get around him. His only weakness is flying creatures, but [Angelic Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Destiny) solves that little problem.  
  
He's not unkillable and vulnerable to several cards in other decks, but Thrun shrugs off most of the combat tricks of all decks. At a low cost. And can be buffed by you or allies. He's extra fun with lifelink. No green deck should be without it.  
  
Edited as I forgot white.
posts.html:
Ah Thrun, the card that every color hates. can't cancel it, bounce it, or control it, can't bolt it, at best it's a life engine for with lifelink cards, can't arrest or tap them, and all can hope for is to trample over him or play the same card. Ironic that the color of the deck that plays him is the most common method to get around him. His only weakness is flying creatures, but Angelic Destiny solves that little problem.

He's not unkillable and vulnerable to several cards in other decks, but Thrun shrugs off most of the combat tricks of all decks. At a low cost. And can be buffed by you or allies. He's extra fun with lifelink. No green deck should be without it.

Edited as I forgot white.

posts.post_content: Incredibly underrated in standard. RDW can't get through him (unless they've splashed heavy black for Geth's Verdict or similar); control can't counter him; very little can get rid of him. At worst, he's chump blocking ground forces all day long, at best he's a 5 turn clock.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: @Totema: I'm pretty sure you can counter something that is hexproof if it doesn't say it can't be countered. The hexproof effect only protects it after it enters the battlefield, not while it's a spell on the stack.
